column4: hi, im new to ubuntu, i am having a problem getting youtube videos to play, can someone help me out?
visit http://www.macromedia.com/software/flash/about/ and click on the yellow bar that shows up
did what exactly?  You were given two suggestions
pastebin the output of 'apt-cache policy flashplugin-nonfree
no, you need to open a terminal, run the command 'apt-cache policy flashplugin-nonfree' and pastebin *that*.  Remember to prefix what you say with the nick of who you are addressing
oo ok thanks i'll try that
k, now close all instances of firefox, and visit http://www.macromedia.com/software/flash/about/ .  What does it say about your version of flash?
ok then why when i hit play on youtube it just skips over the video and says share/ watch again?
well you do have an old version for some reason.  Have you installed some other flash as well?  Maybe gnash or a version you installed manually before?
sorry, ive only been on here like 2 weeks, total newb
no problem, glad you got it
